The velocity field \\( \\vec{u}(x,t) \\) of the fluid is influenced by a forcing function \\( \\vec{F}(x,t) \\). If the initial velocity field \\( \\vec{u}_0(x) \\) is transformed by \\( \\vec{u}'_0(x) = \\vec{u}_0(x) + \\nabla \\phi_0(x) \\) and then allowed to evolve under the normal Navier-Stokes dynamics without further intervention, will \\( \\vec{u}(x,T) \\) at time T be identical to the field evolved from \\( \\vec{u}_0(x) \\) to T?
Explanation: The addition of the gradient of the scalar potential \\( \\nabla \\phi \\) modulates the initial condition, altering the trajectory of the velocity field. Variations in the potential \\( \\phi \\), which might adhere to different dynamics, can lead to distinct outcomes in the evolved field at time T.
